section.para: Represents a statement in the target language which explains (but does not translate) the meaning of the headword. Example: .

section.title: SQL
section.programlisting: create table headwordExplanations ( senseID int foreign key references senses(id), language nvarchar(10) foreign key references translationLanguage(langCode), text nvarchar(255), id int primary key )

listitem.para: language indicates the language of this explanation. You can use the translationLanguage datatype to explain the meaning of the language codes that appear here and/or to constrain which language codes are allowed.
If ony one translation language exists in your lexicographic resource, then language can be left out.
It is assume that there will always be a maximum of one headwordExplanation per translation language.
